alert.note: Alert for Brevard; Indian River; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 12:48PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Brevard, Indian River and St. Lucie. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1246 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Pierce, Sebastian, Vero Beach, Fellsmere, Indian River Shores, Wabasso, Gifford, Sebastian Highlands, Vero Beach South, Roseland, Sebastian Inlet, Barefoot Bay, Vero Lake Estates, Sebastian Inlet State Park, Lakewood Park, Micco and Treasure Coast Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
